subject: Climate & Environment
title: Deep Sea Mining
description: A 60-second lesson on Deep Sea Mining.

hook.text: The deep ocean floor holds trillions of dollars in metals. Companies want to mine it.

buildup.text: Polymetallic nodules on the seafloor contain manganese, cobalt, nickel â€” all needed for batteries.

discovery.text: Mining would vacuum the ocean floor, destroying habitats that took millions of years to form.

twist.text: Deep-sea ecosystems are barely explored. We may destroy species before we discover them.

climax.text: Over 30 countries have called for a moratorium. The debate is intensifying.

punchline.text: We're about to mine a world we don't even understand yet.

quiz.question: What are polymetallic nodules?
options: Metal-rich rocks on the deep ocean floor
